page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY - GREENSIDE.
page.content: The Lead Road runs through our village. This road ran from Tyneside to Weardale where the lead miners used to be. The miners carried the lead ore on pack horses and carts along the road. The pack horses stopped at a public house called "The Bird". This is now Mr Robinson's farm in the middle of the village. Greenside was a coal mining village, but it is no longer because the mine was closed down. On the Temperence Green was a pond which was the pit pond. Behind Burnhills Gardens was a "dilly" line. This was a railway line with small trucks on and the miners put coal in the trucks to send down the railway line to the next stop. The miners used to send coal to Stargate on this line. It is now a line which is overgrown with bushes, grass and flowers.
